title: Stock Investment Criteria for a Great Company
headline: Use these eleven stock investing criteria to help you choose the best shares in this free online stock trading course.
description: Stock investors face difficult decisions when investing money. Examining the massive amount of data available related to public companies can be time-consuming. Fortunately, we have done all of the legwork for you. In this stock trading course, we examine Warren Buffett's four investing rules and the eleven stock investing criteria used by the UKâ€™s Securities and Futures Authority (SFA) to select fundamentally sound companies for investment.
courseDescription:
The internet lets investors easily access free, real-time data with the click of a button but selecting the appropriate information for assessing and evaluating a specific stock remains a challenge. Although the stock market can appear random at times, making good investment decisions is a science. Professional investors consider key criteria when deciding whether to invest in a stock or not and this investment course teaches you how to do the same to reduce the risk and stress of making such decisions.


We want our students at Stewardship Finance Academy to discover the next great companies that will compound shareholder returns over the next two to five years. We provide a set of eight primary and three secondary factors used to evaluate any investment and identify undervalued great companies. These eleven criteria should not be viewed in isolation but complement each other to allow you to assess and predict a company's market position.


The course discusses the specifics of these criteria to show you how they can be harnessed to evaluate the company and its potential. We help you to stop thinking of the stock market as a game of chance as these criteria clarifies and rationalises your buy and sell decisions. Sign up to learn how to read online metrics and make informed investment decisions using the same criteria employed by experts and moguls.
